name: AIM-9X Sidewinder
description:
The AIM-9 Sidewinder is a short-range air-to-air missile which entered service with the US Navy in 1956 and subsequently was adopted by the US Air Force in 1964. 

Since then the Sidewinder has proved to be an enduring international success, and its latest variants are still standard equipment in most western-aligned air forces.

 The X version improved upon the design by adding thrust vectoring, helmet mounted display support which dramatically increase maneuverability and seeker field of view.
